text: Balakote (also known as Bala Kote) is a village and tehsil in Poonch district of the Indian union territory of Jammu and Kashmir. The village is located 63 kilometres from the district headquarters, Poonch. ==Demographics== According to the 2011 census of India, Balnoi has 103 households. The literacy rate of Balakote was 79.89% compared to 67.16% of Jammu and Kashmir. In Balakote, Male literacy stands at 91.77% while the female literacy rate was 71.16%. {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Demographics (2011 Census) ! !! Total !! Male !! Female |- | Population || 461 || 216 || 245 |- | Children aged below 6 years || 88 || 58 || 30 |- | Scheduled caste || 0 || 0 || 0 |- | Scheduled tribe || 55 || 20 || 35 |- | Literacy || 79.89% || 91.77% || 71.16% |- | Workers (all) || 314 || 132 || 182 |- | Main workers (all) || 46 || – || – |- | Marginal workers (total) || 268 || 104 || 164 |} ==Transport== ===Road=== Balakote is well-connected by road to other places in Jammu and Kashmir and India by the NH 144A and BG Surankote Road. ===Rail=== The nearest railway stations to Balakote are Jammu Tawi railway station and Awantipora railway station located at a distance of 199 kilometres and 161 kilometres respectively. ===Air=== The nearest airport to Balakote is Srinagar International Airport located at a distance of 187 kilometres and is a 6-hour drive. ==See also== *Jammu and Kashmir *Poonch district *Poonch ==References== Category:Villages in Balakote tehsil
title: Balakote
